Package jblob.util

Class ArrayUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • jblob.util.ArrayUtils
  • public class ArrayUtils
extends Object
    Provides a collection of useful array manipulation methods.
    Author:
    David J. Pearce

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static byte[] append​(byte[] lhs, byte[] rhs)
      Append two byte arrays type together, producing a fresh array whose length equals that of the first and second added together.
      static <T> T[] append​(T[] lhs, T rhs)
      Append an items onto the end of an array of unknown type together, producing a fresh array whose length equals that of the first and second added together.
      static <T> T[] insert​(int index, T item, T[] items)
      Insert a given item into an array of items at the given position producing an updated array where everything else remains unchanged.
      static <T extends Comparable<T>>
      boolean      		 isSorted​(T[] children)
      Check whether or not the elements of this array are sorted according to their underlying order or not.
      static <T> T[] remove​(int i, int j, T[] items)
      Remove all items between i and j (inclusive) from a given array.
      static <T> T[] removeAll​(T[] items, T item)
      Remove any occurrence of a given value from an array.
      static byte[] replace​(byte[] bytes, int offset, int length, byte[] replacement)
      Replace a sequence of bytes in a given array with another sequence (which may have a different size).

      • replace

        public static byte[] replace​(byte[] bytes,
                             int offset,
                             int length,
                             byte[] replacement)
        Replace a sequence of bytes in a given array with another sequence (which may have a different size).
        Parameters:
        bytes - The original sequence of bytes
        offset - The offset in the original sequence where replacement begins
        length - The length of the region in the original sequence being replaced
        replacement - The bytes which are replacing the given region in the original sequence
        Returns:

      • append

        public static <T> T[] append​(T[] lhs,
                             T rhs)
        Append an items onto the end of an array of unknown type together, producing a fresh array whose length equals that of the first and second added together.
        Parameters:
        lhs - The left-hand side. Elements of this array will be copied first into the resulting array.
        rhs - The right-hand side which will form the last element of the resulting array
        Returns:

      • append

        public static byte[] append​(byte[] lhs,
                            byte[] rhs)
        Append two byte arrays type together, producing a fresh array whose length equals that of the first and second added together.
        Parameters:
        lhs - The left-hand side. Elements of this array will be copied first into the resulting array.
        rhs - The right-hand side. Elements of this array will be copied last into the resulting array.
        Returns:

      • removeAll

        public static <T> T[] removeAll​(T[] items,
                                T item)
        Remove any occurrence of a given value from an array. The resulting array may be shorter in length, but the relative position of all other items will remain unchanged. This algorithm is robust to null. The items array may contain null values and the item may itself be null (in which case, all null values are removed).
        Parameters:
        items -
        Returns:

      • remove

        public static <T> T[] remove​(int i,
                             int j,
                             T[] items)
        Remove all items between i and j (inclusive) from a given array. This is guaranteed to return a new array when i!=j.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        i -
        j -
        items -
        Returns:
